place.name: HOWELL
place.gazetteerText: HOWELL, a parish in Sleaford district, Lincoln; 1¾. mile NNW of Heckington r. station, and 4½ N by E of Sleaford. Post town, Sleaford. Acres, 1, 650. Real property, £1, 985. Pop., 72. Houses, 13. The property is divided among a few. The living is a rectory in the diocese of Lincoln. Value, £124. Patron, H. Machin, Esq. The church is good; has some Norman traces; and contains some very ancient monuments. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
